subject: Technology
title: Voyager: The Farthest Human-Made Object
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Voyager: The Farthest Human-Made Object.

hook.text: Voyager 1 has been flying away from Earth since 1977. It is now over 15 billion miles away.

buildup.text: It visited Jupiter and Saturn, sending back the first detailed photos of those giant planets.

discovery.text: In 2012, Voyager 1 crossed into interstellar space. It is the only human-made object to leave the solar system.

twist.text: Voyager carries a golden record with sounds of Earth: music, greetings, and nature. A message in a bottle for aliens.

climax.text: Its computer has 70 kilobytes of memory. Your phone has millions of times more, yet Voyager still transmits.

punchline.text: Humanity's farthest traveler runs on less memory than a photo.

quiz.question: What milestone did Voyager 1 reach in 2012?
